author: carilyn c

comments.message: Thank you for raising such an important and concerning issue, Carilyn. You might consider inviting Roots of Empathy or Start Empathy to the platform so we can benefit from their learnings and inspiring work.
That's a good idea...  ... I sent them an email invitation just now...

Thanks for posting about Roots of Empathy Carilyn.  I think their work is amazing.  I heard one of their staff present their work at a talk at Mount Sinai Hospital.  I was floored by their approach and their results. (and was upset that their work has not been picked up more extensively.  Hard to accept sometimes that funding stands in the way of potential for good.)  It would be interesting to get their perspective on this issue!

description:
African Boys Attacked at Bronx School, Called "Ebola"

http://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/Senegal-Boys-Attacked-Bullying-IS-318-Tremont-NYC-280519232.html

"...two brothers who had recently immigrated to the borough from Senegal were beaten and severely injured by several people who called them “Ebola.” "

We need more programs like Roots of Empathy for school kids:
http://www.rootsofempathy.org/en/where-we-are/usa/washington-d-c.html

And StartEmpathy.org:
http://startempathy.org/

Because bullying is a problem from as young as age three:
